name: Math-expression-evaluator
tagline: A simple but efficient evaluator for Math expression using Javascript
body:
## INTRODUCTION
A simple to use and efficient evaluator for Math expression using Javascript

## How to use

##Basic usage
Parse an expression using
	var parsed = a.parse(exp);
which returns a Array which will further processed by toPostFix and postFixEval
That Object is needed to be converted to postfix
	var postfix = parsed.toPostfix();
which converts the array to Postfix notation and return new one
Now to get the value of expression use postfixEval
	var result = postfix.postfixEval();
which is results
##Using variables
If your expression has user defined variables like hundred = 100 then parse takes another argument for user defined variable
	var parsed = a.parse(exp,{hundred:100});
To evaluate variable also pass the key-value pair to postfixEval
	var result = postfix.postfixEval({hundred:100});
note: Don't delete this file! It's used internally to help with page regeneration.
